instructions.2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and pan-fry until cooked through and juices run clear, about 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
instructions.3: Cook onion in butter in the same skillet until translucent but not brown, about 5 to 8 minutes. Season with paprika and salt.
instructions.4: Pour chicken stock into the pan and bring to a boil.
instructions.5: Reduce heat to simmer; mix sour cream with flour until smooth, then whisk into chicken stock.
instructions.6: Place chicken in skillet; simmer until chicken is heated through and sauce has thickened.
